snippet: The monologuist Daniel Kitson returns to St. Ann’s Warehouse with a one-man show about two people who never knew each other in 19th-century England.
abstract: Ben Brantley reviews St Ann's Warehouse production of one-man play It's Always Right Now, Until It's Later, written and performed by Daniel Kitson.
lead_paragraph: The monologuist Daniel Kitson returns to St. Ann’s Warehouse with a one-man show about two people who never knew each other in 19th-century England.

headline.seo: ‘It’s Always Right Now, Until It’s Later’ - Review
headline.main: Parallel Points of Light Ricochet Across Time
